structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Fraudulently Obtaining Benefits Under Insurance Contract; Runners; Punishment

text.section: As used in this section, the following words shall have the following meanings:â€”

Whoever knowingly acts as a runner or uses, solicits, directs, hires or employs another to act as a runner for the purpose of defrauding an insured or an insurance carrier shall be punished by imprisonment in the state prison for not more than 5 years, by imprisonment in a jail or house of correction for not less than 6 months nor more than 21/2 years or by a fine of not less than $1,000 nor more than $4,000.
